projects.title: Infineon
projects.description: Infineon Technologies is a German microchip manufacturer. A multi-billion dollar company with a very outdated visual identity. I decided to change that in my greatest project so far. Let us welcome to the world the newly refined, reimagined and redesigned Infineon.

projects.title: Zephyr
projects.description: Dopamine nowadays is a largely abused neurochemical. It is getting harder and harder to find motivation in a world designed around instant pleasures. Zephyr is a hopeful attempt to push the people towards reconnecting with themselves. Becoming mindful of the world inside you and around you. Just breathe.

projects.title: Monkey Dream
projects.description: Self-limiting yourself in design is a neat practice for coming up with unexpected ideas and results. This is how Monkey Dream was born. A mini-artbook designed using expositions of digital and physical experimentaion with different ways to communicate the idea of a banana. And yes, it was very fun.

projects.title: Riot-Related Injuries
projects.description: Less lethal weapons - a term used for police weapons employed in anti-riot activities. Its original design was to minimize the damage dealt to protesters when dispersing the crowd, while still being an effective tool. However more often they deal serious injuries like cuts, fractures and lacerations. This project relies on real-life protest injuries data from Lebanese protests and visualizes the most common injuries in an experimental bar chart.

projects.title: Typography of Oppression
projects.description: How does police communicate with the protesters? Is it with words like other humans? Or is it with police batons, shields, pepper sprays, gas cannisters and physical force? And what if we try to put those injuries into living words? Each word is a living organism representing a body of a protester malformed by injuries received from police.

projects.title: Cage
projects.description: Totalitarian existence (not life) is best viewed through the prism of absurdity and sarcasm. Bold slogans of the party shaping your individual self into a collective idenity and daily distractions. I wanted to capture that by mixing digital media and physical typography experiments for poster design. So how many fingers, Winston?

projects.title: Concrete Position
projects.description: I don't really do politics. I prefer to stay neutral. Ever heard these words? In reality though the true neutraility does not and can not exist. Even a corpse is not neutral as it embodies the role of a fertilizer for other organisms. In totalitarian state, the word Neutral actually means - I am choosing the side of the government and do not voice my opinion by staying silent as they told me. Well here is my take on how absurd neutrality looks from another angle.

projects.title: Prussian Culture Museum
projects.description: Prussian heritage was viciously erased after the WW1 and WW2. Language just barely survived and is now spoken by very few. As a result of collaboration with Prussian Community of Lithuania on historical matters and Vilnius Academy of Arts on design aspects, we attempted to conceptualize how could a modern Prussian Culture Museum look like in Klaipeda, Lithuania.

projects.title: Edge of Perception
projects.description: The Riot Police Helmet has a protective glass which oficially serves to defend the face and eyes of the police from various sharp objects and liquids being thrown at them. In reality however this becomes the only visual border between the eyes of the protester and the policeman. Thus, protective glass of a riot police helmet is an edge of one's perception. But what does it really protect? Or whom? And from what? But most importantly - what can happen if anyone gets control over such visual filter?

projects.title: Favelagrafia
projects.description: “Favelagrafia” is an art group of 9 Brazilian artists, pro and amateur, originating from favelas. Their goal is to break the stereotypical representation of favelas as vile and dangerous places, to show that they are full of talented, creative people. My project manipulates their imagery to create a dichotomy between the stereotypical, “classical” representations of favelas and the cultural, artistic ones.

projects.title: Holy
projects.description: A never-ending quest of distilling my own identity. “HOLY” is an attempt to identify the depths of who I am, then try to transcend it in visual form. What started as a childish nickname to be represented by in video games, has evolved into a visual identity title. (Currently work in progress)

projects.title: Shameless Snacks
projects.description: Sugar is quite difficult not to crave. Expecially when there are so many candies, deserts, cakes and other sweet miracles around. Shameless Snacks wanted to allow people to indulge in their sweet desires while not compromising on health. As a part of a test task, they asked me to develop email design, social media post and social media animation for their product.

projects.title: Veles
projects.description: There are close to none references to paganism in modern Belarus. Ironically, at the time of designing this project I had close to none experience in packaging design. And so I wanted to play with traditional Belarusian patterns and pagan references to the drink that would be symbolic to this region. Just like wine flooded Rome, mead was drank from horns by our forest ancestors.

projects.title: Aqua 2025
projects.description: AQUA 2025 (or Aquaculture Europe 2025) is the European Aquaculture Society congress and trade show featuring scientific sessions, an international exhibition, industry forums, and EU research updates. It also featured E-Poster (Electronic Poster) presentations from scientists and researchers all over Europe. I was responsible for designing such E-Poster for a team of Ukrainian aquatic researchers, investigating the damage done to Ukrainian water ecosystems as a result of war.

projects.title: Terraform
projects.description: Concrete jungles are being built with incredible speed. They replace natual greenery and damage the planet's entire ecosystem. Attemps to preserve the greenery are usually futile. Terraform is a conceptualized architecture bureau promoting biophilic design - merging the humans' necessity for buildings with respect to the ancient presence of nature.

projects.title: Kill Your Friends
projects.description: A song cover design done for my friend's music band Rose and Concrete.
